model_answer:
The correct answer(s) are C: Event 1 sub-event: She frames the video by defining the GRE and setting up the ensuing discussion about preparation, which leads into her verbal section tips.

Explanation: The mention of the GRE and its preparation sets the context for the rest of the events in the video. It also explains why the speaker would discuss strategies for the verbal section of the test. This event directly leads into the subsequent discussion about studying and preparing for the exam. The other events mentioned may be relevant to the topic, but they do not directly set up or trigger the man's reaction in Event 4.

The most plausible earlier moments leading to this transition are:

A: Event 2 sub-event: The on-screen text “ETS.org/GRE” appears and she says she will go on the website to show where she found most of the information.
C: Event 1 sub-event: The video frames GRE requirements and includes an on-screen prompt to watch “Navigating the GRE website,” foreshadowing the walkthrough.

This is because the presenter mentions going to the ETS.org/GRE website and finding most of the information there, which aligns with Event 2 (sub-event A). Additionally, the mention of navigating the GRE website in the video preview (Event 1) suggests that the topic of the video involves the GRE website, supporting option C. Option B does not fit as it only references sending scores and numbers, while Option D does not relate to the GRE website at all.
